segments.text: How many people are there in your family ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My immediate family is quite small . It ’ s just my older step-brother , my mom , my step-dad and me . how about you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I have a large family . I have three older sisters , my twin sister , a younger brother , and parents .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I didn ’ t know you were a twin ! Are you identical or fraternal ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We ’ re identical . I mean , we look exactly the same , but we are complete opposites when it comes to everything else .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Interesting . It must be great having a twin sister . Are you best friends , too ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We used to be really close , but that all changed once she moved to Shanghai . How about your family ? You didn ’ t mention to your biological father .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don ’ t know much about him . He died when I was just a baby . Even though I don ’ t have a blood relationship with my step-father and step-brother , I consider them to be my real family .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What about your step-brother ’ s mother ? Does he keep in touch with her ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , she also died when my step-brother was little . My mother and my step-father met each other shortly after my father died and became good friends . They ended up getting married a few years later .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sounds like it was meant to be .
segments.speaker: S1
